title: Hero MotoCorp reports nominal Q1 PAT growth despite lower sales, beats Street estimates
summary: Hero MotoCorp reported a slight increase in net profit to Rs 1125.70 crore for Q1 2025, despite a 5.6% drop in revenue to Rs 9578.86 crore and a 10.9% decrease in two-wheeler sales. The company's EBITDA margin remained stable at 14.4%.
fullContent: Hero MotoCorp reported a slight increase in net profit to Rs 1125.70 crore for Q1 2025, despite a 5.6% drop in revenue to Rs 9578.86 crore and a 10.9% decrease in two-wheeler sales. The company's EBITDA margin remained stable at 14.4%. Executives are optimistic about future growth due to positive customer sentiment, the upcoming festive season, and new product launches.

title: JSW Cement IPO: Company raises Rs 1,080 crore from anchor investors ahead of issue
summary: JSW Cement secured Rs 1,080 crore from anchor investors before its IPO launch. The IPO opens on Thursday and closes on Monday. It includes a fresh issue and an offer for sale. Funds will support a new facility and debt repayment. The IPO price is Rs 139-147 per share.
fullContent: JSW Cement secured Rs 1,080 crore from anchor investors before its IPO launch. The IPO opens on Thursday and closes on Monday. It includes a fresh issue and an offer for sale. Funds will support a new facility and debt repayment. The IPO price is Rs 139-147 per share.

title: Trump Imposes 50% Tariffs on Indian Imports Over Russian Oil Purchases
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump has signed an executive order enacting an additional 25% tariff on Indian goods, explicitly targeting India’s ongoing imports of Russian crude oil. This order increases the total tariff rate on Indian exports to the United States to 50%, the highest...
fullContent: U.S. President Donald Trump has signed an executive order enacting an additional 25% tariff on Indian goods, explicitly targeting India’s ongoing imports of Russian crude oil. This order increases the total tariff rate on Indian exports to the United States to 50%, the highest level for any country under current U.S. policy. According to the executive order (effective 21 days after signing, beginning at 12:01 a.m. ET), duties will apply to goods entered for consumption or withdrawn from warehouses on or after that time. In an accompanying…

title: Indian households anticipate modest commodity price increases amid declining inflation expectations
summary: A recent RBI survey indicates Indian households anticipate moderate commodity price increases. Inflation expectations have decreased, with the median perception dropping to 7.2% in July. RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra noted a more favorable inflation outlook for 2025-26,...
fullContent: A recent RBI survey indicates Indian households anticipate moderate commodity price increases. Inflation expectations have decreased, with the median perception dropping to 7.2% in July. RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra noted a more favorable inflation outlook for 2025-26, attributing it to base effects and monsoon progress. While fewer expect food price hikes, more anticipate increases in durable goods and service costs.

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Thursday
summary: The Indian stock market experienced a downturn on Wednesday. The Reserve Bank of India's decision to maintain interest rates impacted rate-sensitive stocks. BSE Sensex declined by 0.21 percent. NSE Nifty also saw a decrease of 0.31 percent.
fullContent: The Indian stock market experienced a downturn on Wednesday. The Reserve Bank of India's decision to maintain interest rates impacted rate-sensitive stocks. BSE Sensex declined by 0.21 percent. NSE Nifty also saw a decrease of 0.31 percent. Analysts suggest the market showed resilience despite global trade concerns. Investors are closely watching key support levels. Market sentiments were largely bearish.

title: Schneider Electric Infrastructure Limited
summary: Schneider Electric Infrastructure Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'In continuation to our previous intimation vide letter no. SEIL/Sec./SE/2024-25/105 dated March 27, 2025 and pursuant to Regulation 30 of the Listing Regulations, we hereby inform you that upon the...
fullContent: Schneider Electric Infrastructure Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'In continuation to our previous intimation vide letter no. SEIL/Sec./SE/2024-25/105 dated March 27, 2025 and pursuant to Regulation 30 of the Listing Regulations, we hereby inform you that upon the Company s filing of the application, the Hon ble High Court of Gujarat at Ahmedabad has, on August 5, 2025, granted a stay order against the order passed contrary to the court s directions by the Assessment Unit, Income Tax Department, Government of India under Section 147 read with section 144B of the Income tax Act for the Assessment Year 2017-18, demanding tax amount of INR 18,52,64,754/- after income adjustments ( Assessment Order ).As per the stay order, the enforcement and execution of the said Assessment Order are stayed pending the disposal of our writ petition.We shall keep you informed of any further updates as and when received.'. |SUBJECT: Updates
